title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: ==Background==

Biden narrowly won the state of Georgia during the [[2020 US presidential election]], which many considered to be a "swing state", with a very small margin of votes. Nevertheless, the [[Trump campaign]] continued to claim disputed accounts of voter fraud, the majority of which were largely dismissed. Trump's legal campaigns of voter fraud were overwhelmingly refuted in legal claims, although Trump has repeatedly refused to accept the election results.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/electoral-college/allocation.html|title=Distribution of Electoral Votes|website=[[National Archives and Records Administration]]|access-date=January 3, 2019}}</ref> Audits were made and hand recounts were asked, all of which had ultimately concluded there was no evidence of widespread voter fraud that would considerably change the results.
==Taped Conversation==

During the phonecall, Donald Trump mantained incorrectly that he had won the State of Georgia for his re-election, continuing to insist that the election results were wrong. Afterwards, Trump reportedly started to begin threats to Raffensperger, after it became clear that his attempts to persuation would not work. In a certain passage of the tape, he claimed that what he needed was "11.780" votes, and that Raffensperger should "reevaluate" the election's results, claiming a myriad of different conspiracy theories regarding voting in the state. Raffensperger, in response, answered that the election results in that state were correct and legitimate, and that Trump "had got his data wrong."<ref>{{citeweb|url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/d45acb92-4dc4-11eb-bda4-615aaefd0555_story.html|title = ‘I just want to find 11,780 votes’: In extraordinary hour-long call, Trump pressures Georgia secretary of state to recalculate the vote in his favor}}</ref> During his attempts to pressure [[Raffensperger]] into changing the election results, at some point Trump claimed "I just want to find 11,780" votes in order to turn the state of Georgia. During different points of the conversation Trump had asked for his support for the Republican Party in an alleged partisan manner, and at other points threatened him with legal action if Raffensperger would not cooperate with the president.

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: Georgia Senator [[David Perdue]] told Fox News in a January 3 interview that recording and leaking the conversation, allegedly by Raffensperger, was "disgusting" and that "what the President said in this state today is no different than what he's been saying for the last two months."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hains |first1=Tim |title=David Perdue Says It is "Disgusting" Trump Call With Georgia Secretary Of State Was Leaked |url=https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2021/01/03/david_perdue_says_it_is_disgusting_trump_call_with_georgia_secretary_of_state_was_leaked.html |website=Real Clear Politics |access-date=4 January 2021 |format=Video}}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: On January 4, 2021, Democratic congressional leaders, believing Trump "engaged in solicitation of, or conspiracy to commit, a number of election crimes", requested the FBI to investigate the incident.<ref name="NBC-20210104">{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Allan |last2=Moe |first2=Alex |title=Democrats ask FBI Director Wray to open criminal probe into Trump after leaked phone call - Reps. Ted Lieu and Kathleen Rice wrote that they believe Trump "engaged in solicitation of, or conspiracy to commit, a number of election crimes." |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/democrats-ask-fbi-director-wray-open-criminal-probe-trump-after-n1252732 |date=January 4, 2021 |work=[[NBC News]] |accessdate=January 4, 2021 }}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: This entire page is complete nonsensical misinformation.  Please go and actually listen to the hour long call.  Trump didn’t pressure anyone to “find me votes”.  This call actually made Raffensperger look extremely bad.  When he said they only need to find 11,780 votes, he was referring to the fact that 11,780 is all they need and they have identified many multiple times more than that from different types of fraudulent votes.  He actually outright states that.

This call actually made Raffensperger look extremely bad.  When he said they only need to find 11,780 votes, he was referring to the fact that 11,780 is all they need and they have identified many multiple times more than that from different types of fraudulent votes.  He actually outright states that.

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: On January 2, 2021, during an hour-long conference call, United States president [[Donald Trump]] pressured [[Georgia Secretary of State]] [[Brad Raffensperger]] to change [[2020 United States presidential election in Georgia|the state's vote totals]] from the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]], in which Trump was defeated by [[Joe Biden]]. Trump has refused to accept the outcome of the presidential election,<ref>{{cite web|url = https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|title = Trump, on tape, presses Ga. official to 'find' him votes|work=AP News|first1=Jeff|last1=Amy|first2=Darlene|last2=Superville|first3=Kate|last3=Brumback|date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021}}</ref> and has made an [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|unprecedented effort to overturn it]]. Trump's call with Raffensperger was first reported by ''[[The Washington Post]]'' and other media outlets the day after it took place.<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia.html|title = Trump, in Taped Call, Pressured Georgia Official to 'Find' Votes to Overturn Election|first1=Michael D.|last1=Shear|first2=Stephanie|last2=Saul|author-link=Michael D. Shear|authorlink2=Stephanie Saul|work=The New York Times|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021}}

</ref><ref name="trump begs">{{cite web|url = https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-begs-georgia-secretary-state-overturn-election-results-remarkable-hourlong-n1252692|title = Trump begs Georgia secretary of state to overturn election results in remarkable hourlong phone call|work=NBC News|first1=Allan|last1=Smith|first2=Julia|last2=Jester|first3=Priscilla|last3=Thompson|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021}}</ref><ref name="trump demands">{{cite web|url = https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-demands-georgia-secretary-state-find-votes-hand/story?id=75027350|title = Trump demands Georgia secretary of state 'find' enough votes to hand him win|work=ABC News|first=Quinn|last=Scanlon|date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021}}</ref> According to the publicly-released recording of the call and reports made by multiple news agencies, Trump attempted to pressure the Secretary into "finding him votes", despite being repeatedly told that there was no electoral error. Trump's repeated efforts to convince the Secretary to find some basis to overturn the election results were perceived as pleading and threatening. At one point on the call, Trump told Raffensperger, "What I want to do is this. I just want to find 11,780 votes, which is one more than [the 11,779 vote margin of defeat], because we won the state."<ref>{{cite web|url = https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|title = 'This Was A Scam': In Recorded Call, Trump Pushed Official To Overturn Georgia Vote|work=NPR|first=Stephen|last=Fowler|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021}}</ref> Trump falsely suggested that Raffensperger could have committed a criminal offense, though Trump’s call likely violated state and federal laws.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Lipton|first=Eric|date=2021-01-04|title=Trump Call to Georgia Official Might Violate State and Federal Law|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|author=Katelyn Polantz and Christina Carrega|title=Trump's call could put the President in jeopardy, legal experts say|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/04/politics/trump-call-legal-jeopardy/index.html|access-date=2021-01-04|website=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Trump's Call To Georgia Election Officials Sparks Debate Over Legality, Ethics|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics|access-date=2021-01-04|website=NPR.org|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Greve (now)|first=Joan E.|last2=Holmes (earlier)|first2=Oliver|last3=Pengelly|first3=Martin|last4=Pengelly|first4=Martin|date=2021-01-04|title='Easily, provably false': Georgia elections official refutes Trump's baseless claims of fraud – live|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2021/jan/04/donald-trump-georgia-votes-joe-biden-brad-raffensperger-senate-covid-coronavirus-us-politics-live|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Millhiser|first=Ian|date=2021-01-04|title=4 criminal laws that Trump may have violated in his Georgia election call|url=https://www.vox.com/2021/1/4/22213031/trump-georgia-crime-criminal-brad-raffensperger-election-call-fraud-felony|access-date=2021-01-04|website=Vox|language=en}}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: The day after the Trump call was disclosed, Repubican Georgia voting system implementation manager Gabriel Sterling sharply refuted Trump's claims of election fraud during a press conference with Raffensberger, listing and debunking several claims made by Trump and his allies that thousands of teenagers, dead people, and unregistered citizens had voted, and a misleading video that had been distributed showing fake ballots being secretly retrieved from suitcases.<ref>https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953321408/georgia-election-official-dont-let-misinformation-suppress-your-own-vote</ref><ref>https://www.mediaite.com/tv/georgia-election-official-systematically-dismantles-trump-fraud-claims-in-brutal-presser-its-obvious-his-team-intentionally-misled-americans/</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: The day after the Trump call was disclosed, Repubican Georgia voting system implementation manager Gabriel Sterling sharply refuted Trump's claims of election fraud during a press conference with Raffensberger, listing and debunking several claims made by Trump and his allies that thousands of teenagers, dead people, and unregistered citizens had voted, and a misleading video that had been distributedsupposedlyshowing fake ballots being secretly retrieved from suitcases.<ref>https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953321408/georgia-election-official-dont-let-misinformation-suppress-your-own-vote</ref><ref>https://www.mediaite.com/tv/georgia-election-official-systematically-dismantles-trump-fraud-claims-in-brutal-presser-its-obvious-his-team-intentionally-misled-americans/</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: The day after the Trump call was disclosed, Repubican Georgia voting system implementation manager Gabriel Sterling sharply refuted Trump's claims of election fraud during a press conference with Raffensberger, listing and debunking several claims made by Trump and his allies that thousands of teenagers, dead people, and unregistered citizens had voted, and a misleading video that had been distributed supposedly showing fake ballots being secretly retrieved from suitcases.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953321408/georgia-election-official-dont-let-misinformation-suppress-your-own-vote|title=Georgia Election Official: Don't Let Misinformation 'Suppress Your Own Vote'|website=NPR.org}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mediaite.com/tv/georgia-election-official-systematically-dismantles-trump-fraud-claims-in-brutal-presser-its-obvious-his-team-intentionally-misled-americans/|title=Georgia Election Official Systematically Dismantles Trump Fraud Claims in Brutal Presser: His Team 'Intentionally Misled' Americans|date=January 4, 2021}}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: The day after the Trump call was disclosed, Repubican Georgia voting system implementation manager Gabriel Sterling sharply refuted Trump's claims of election fraud during a press conference with Raffensberger, listing and debunking several claims made by Trump and his allies that thousands of teenagers, dead people, and unregistered citizens had voted, and a misleading video that had been distributed supposedly showing fake ballots being secretly retrieved from suitcases.Sterling stated, "The president’s legal team had the entire tape, they watched the entire tape, and from our point of view, intentionally misled the state’s senate, voters and the people of the United States about this. It was intentional. It was obvious. And anybody watching this knows that."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953321408/georgia-election-official-dont-let-misinformation-suppress-your-own-vote|title=Georgia Election Official: Don't Let Misinformation 'Suppress Your Own Vote'|website=NPR.org}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mediaite.com/tv/georgia-election-official-systematically-dismantles-trump-fraud-claims-in-brutal-presser-its-obvious-his-team-intentionally-misled-americans/|title=Georgia Election Official Systematically Dismantles Trump Fraud Claims in Brutal Presser: His Team 'Intentionally Misled' Americans|date=January 4, 2021}}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: Legal experts stated that Trump's attempt to pressure Raffensperger could have violated election law,<ref name=AmySupervilleBrumback/> including federal and state laws against soliciting election fraud or interference in elections.<ref name="politico-jan3"/><ref>{{Cite web|author=Eric Lipton|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|title=Trump Call to Georgia Official Might Violate State and Federal Law|newspaper=New York Times|date=January 3, 2021}}</ref> Election-law scholar [[Edward B. Foley]] called Trump's conduct "inappropriate and contemptible" while the executive director of [[Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington]] called Trump's attempt "to rig a presidential election ... a low point in American history and unquestionably impeachable conduct."<ref name=PengellyLuscombe/>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: [[Category:2021 controversies in the United States]]
[[Category:2021 in Georgia (U.S. state)]]
[[Category:January 2021 events in the United States]]

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: {{multiple image

On January 2, 2021, during an hour-long conference call, U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] pressured [[Georgia Secretary of State]] [[Brad Raffensperger]] to overturn the [[2020 United States presidential election in Georgia|the state's election results]] in the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]], citing unfounded fraud claims. Trump was defeated by [[Joe Biden]] in the election, but has refused to accept the outcome<ref name="AmySupervilleBrumback">{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|title=Trump, on tape, presses Ga. official to 'find' him votes|work=AP News|first1=Jeff|last1=Amy|first2=Darlene|last2=Superville|first3=Kate|last3=Brumback|date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104000015/https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|url-status=live}}</ref> and has made an [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|unprecedented effort to overturn the results]]. Trump's call with Raffensperger was first reported by ''[[The Washington Post]]'' and other media outlets the day after it took place.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia.html|title=Trump, in Taped Call, Pressured Georgia Official to 'Find' Votes to Overturn Election|first1=Michael D.|last1=Shear|first2=Stephanie|last2=Saul|author-link=Michael D. Shear|authorlink2=Stephanie Saul|work=The New York Times|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104002713/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="trump begs">{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-begs-georgia-secretary-state-overturn-election-results-remarkable-hourlong-n1252692|title=Trump begs Georgia secretary of state to overturn election results in remarkable hourlong phone call|work=NBC News|first1=Allan|last1=Smith|first2=Julia|last2=Jester|first3=Priscilla|last3=Thompson|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103234707/https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-begs-georgia-secretary-state-overturn-election-results-remarkable-hourlong-n1252692|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="trump demands">{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-demands-georgia-secretary-state-find-votes-hand/story?id=75027350|title=Trump demands Georgia secretary of state 'find' enough votes to hand him win|work=ABC News|first=Quinn|last=Scanlon|date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104020714/https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-demands-georgia-secretary-state-find-votes-hand/story?id=75027350|url-status=live}}</ref>

According to the publicly released recording of the call and reports made by multiple news agencies, Trump attempted to pressure the Secretary into "finding him votes", despite being repeatedly told that there was no electoral error. Trump's repeated efforts to convince the Secretary to find some basis to overturn the election results were perceived as pleading and threatening. At one point on the call, Trump told Raffensperger, "What I want to do is this. I just want to find 11,780 votes, which is one more than [the 11,779 vote margin of defeat] we have, because we won the state."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|title='This Was A Scam': In Recorded Call, Trump Pushed Official To Overturn Georgia Vote|work=NPR|first=Stephen|last=Fowler|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103233114/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|url-status=live}}</ref> During the call, Trump falsely suggested that Raffensperger could have committed a criminal offense. Legal experts have suggested that Trump's behavior and demands could have violated state and federal laws.<ref>Multiple sources:

* {{Cite news|last=Lipton|first=Eric|date=2021-01-04|title=Trump Call to Georgia Official Might Violate State and Federal Law|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0362-4331|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104192131/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web|first=Katelyn|last=Polantz|first2=Christina|last2=Carrega|title=Trump's call could put the President in jeopardy, legal experts say|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/04/politics/trump-call-legal-jeopardy/index.html|date=January 4, 2021|access-date=2021-01-04|website=CNN|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104214201/https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/04/politics/trump-call-legal-jeopardy/index.html|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web |title=Trump's Call To Georgia Election Officials Sparks Debate Over Legality, Ethics |url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |access-date=2021-01-04 |website=NPR.org |date=January 4, 2021 |first=Jaclyn |last=Diaz |first2=Brian |last2=Naylor |archive-date=January 4, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104234202/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |url-status=live }}

* {{Cite news|last=Greve (now)|first=Joan E.|last2=Holmes (earlier)|first2=Oliver|last3=Pengelly|first3=Martin|last4=Pengelly|first4=Martin|date=2021-01-04|title='Easily, provably false': Georgia elections official refutes Trump's baseless claims of fraud – live|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2021/jan/04/donald-trump-georgia-votes-joe-biden-brad-raffensperger-senate-covid-coronavirus-us-politics-live|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0261-3077|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212447/https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2021/jan/04/donald-trump-georgia-votes-joe-biden-brad-raffensperger-senate-covid-coronavirus-us-politics-live|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web|last=Millhiser|first=Ian|date=2021-01-04|title=4 criminal laws that Trump may have violated in his Georgia election call|url=https://www.vox.com/2021/1/4/22213031/trump-georgia-crime-criminal-brad-raffensperger-election-call-fraud-felony|access-date=2021-01-04|website=Vox|language=en|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104221038/https://www.vox.com/2021/1/4/22213031/trump-georgia-crime-criminal-brad-raffensperger-election-call-fraud-felony|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
deleted: {{Donald Trump series}}On January 2, 2021, Trump held a one-hour phone call with Raffensperger.<ref name="trump begs" /><ref name="CNN-20210103">{{cite news |last1=Duster |first1=Chandelis |last2=Cole |first2=Devan |title=In call, Trump demands Georgia officials 'find' votes to tilt election |url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/03/politics/donald-trump-brad-raffensperger-call-washington-post/index.html |date=January 3, 2021 |work=[[CNN News]] |accessdate=January 3, 2021 |archive-date=January 3, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103193418/https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/03/politics/donald-trump-brad-raffensperger-call-washington-post/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Trump was joined by chief of staff [[Mark Meadows (North Carolina politician)|Mark Meadows]], trade adviser [[Peter Navarro]], Justice Department official [[John Lott|John Lott Jr.]], law professor [[John C. Eastman|John Eastman]] and attorneys [[Rudy Giuliani]], [[Cleta Mitchell]] and [[Kurt Hilbert]]. Raffensperger was joined by his general counsel Ryan Germany.<ref name="postobtained">{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-transcript-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/2768e0cc-4ddd-11eb-83e3-322644d82356_story.html |first=Amy |last=Gardener |first2=Paulina |last2=Firozi |title=The Post has published Trump's full phone call with Georgia election officials. Listen to the audio and read the transcript. |website=[[The Washington Post]] |date=January 3, 2021 |accessdate=January 3, 2021 |archive-date=January 3, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103213550/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-transcript-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/2768e0cc-4ddd-11eb-83e3-322644d82356_story.html |url-status=live }}</ref> On January 3, ''[[The Washington Post]]'' obtained a recording of this phone conversation.<ref name="postobtained" />

During the phone call, Trump maintained falsely that he had won Georgia by "hundreds of thousands of votes", insisting that the certified election results were wrong.{{cite news|url=https://www.cbs19.tv/article/news/politics/elections/trump-tweets-about-fulton-county-brad-raffensperger-brian-kemp/85-a503efec-df8a-42ee-a92f-70271eac840f|title=Trump asks Georgia election officials to 'find' votes during call with Sec. of State|last=Braverman|first=Jason|date=January 4, 2021|work=CBS-19|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104032517/https://www.cbs19.tv/article/news/politics/elections/trump-tweets-about-fulton-county-brad-raffensperger-brian-kemp/85-a503efec-df8a-42ee-a92f-70271eac840f|url-status=live}} He said that Raffensperger should "reevaluate" the election's results, citing a variety of different [[conspiracy theory|conspiracy theories]] regarding voting in the state. Raffensperger, in response, answered that the election results in that state were correct and legitimate, and that Trump "had got his data wrong".{{cite news |work=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/d45acb92-4dc4-11eb-bda4-615aaefd0555_story.html |title='I just want to find 11,780 votes': In extraordinary hour-long call, Trump pressures Georgia secretary of state to recalculate the vote in his favor |date=January 4, 2021 |first=Amy |last=Gardner |access-date=January 4, 2021 |archive-date=January 4, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104001817/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/d45acb92-4dc4-11eb-bda4-615aaefd0555_story.html |url-status=live }} During his attempts to pressure Raffensperger into changing the election results, Trump said, "I just want to find 11,780 votes", the number needed to overcome Biden's advantage in Georgia. Trump also tried to intimidate Raffensperger, hinting that Raffensperger and his attorney could face a possible criminal investigation. Trump said, "You know, that's a criminal offense. And you know, you can't let that happen. That's a big risk to you."{{cite web|last=Sullivan|first=Helen|date=January 4, 2021|title=Trump's phone call to Brad Raffensperger: six key points|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/04/trumps-phone-call-to-brad-raffensperger-five-key-points|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104034922/https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/04/trumps-phone-call-to-brad-raffensperger-five-key-points|archive-date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|work=The Guardian|quote='You know what they did and you're not reporting it,' Trump said. 'You know, that's a criminal offense. And you know, you can't let that happen. That's a big risk to you and to Ryan [Germany], your lawyer. That's a big risk.' [...]
'''5. Trump may have committed a crime...]''' [Richard H Pildes, a constitutional law professor at New York University, told the Washington Post: "The president is either knowingly attempting to coerce state officials into corrupting the integrity of the election or is so deluded that he believes what he's saying." Trump's actions may have violated federal statutes, he said. [...]
Michael R Bromwich, a former federal prosecutor in the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, wrote: "Unless there are portions of the tape that somehow negate criminal intent, 'I just want to find 11,780 votes' and his threats against Raffensperger and his counsel violate 52 U.S. Code 20511.}}

After the Georgia call, Trump and his team spoke on [[Zoom (software)|Zoom]] with officials in Arizona, Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin.<ref name="politico-jan3">{{cite web |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/03/trump-georgia-election-454122 |title=Trump's pressure on Georgia election officials raises legal questions |first1=Allie |last1=Bice |first2=Kyle |last2=Cheney |authorlink2=Kyle Cheney (journalist) |first3=Anita |last3=Kumar |website=[[Politico]] |date=January 3, 2021 |accessdate=January 3, 2021 |archive-date=January 3, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103210936/https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/03/trump-georgia-election-454122 |url-status=live }}</ref>

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: {{multiple image

On January 2, 2021, during an hour-long conference call, U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] pressured [[Georgia Secretary of State]] [[Brad Raffensperger]] to overturn the [[2020 United States presidential election in Georgia|the state's election results]] in the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]], citing unfounded fraud claims. Trump was defeated by [[Joe Biden]] in the election, but has refused to accept the outcome<ref name="AmySupervilleBrumback">{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|title=Trump, on tape, presses Ga. official to 'find' him votes|work=AP News|first1=Jeff|last1=Amy|first2=Darlene|last2=Superville|first3=Kate|last3=Brumback|date=January 4, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104000015/https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|url-status=live}}</ref> and has made an [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|unprecedented effort to overturn the results]]. According to the publicly released recording of the call and reports made by multiple news agencies, Trump attempted to pressure the Secretary into "finding him votes", despite being repeatedly told that there was no electoral error. Trump's repeated efforts to convince the Secretary to find some basis to overturn the election results were perceived as pleading and threatening. At one point on the call, Trump told Raffensperger, "What I want to do is this. I just want to find 11,780 votes, which is one more than [the 11,779 vote margin of defeat] we have, because we won the state."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|title='This Was A Scam': In Recorded Call, Trump Pushed Official To Overturn Georgia Vote|work=NPR|first=Stephen|last=Fowler|date=January 3, 2021|accessdate=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103233114/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|url-status=live}}</ref> During the call, Trump falsely suggested that Raffensperger could have committed a criminal offense. Legal experts have suggested that Trump's behavior and demands could have violated state and federal laws.<ref>Multiple sources:

* {{Cite news|last=Lipton|first=Eric|date=2021-01-04|title=Trump Call to Georgia Official Might Violate State and Federal Law|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0362-4331|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104192131/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web |title=Trump's Call To Georgia Election Officials Sparks Debate Over Legality, Ethics |url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |access-date=2021-01-04 |website=NPR.org |date=January 4, 2021 |first=Jaclyn |last=Diaz |first2=Brian |last2=Naylor |archive-date=January 4, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104234202/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |url-status=live }}

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: Warning: EXCESSIVE LIBERAL BIAS!!!!!FAKE NEWS!!!!

title: Trump–Raffensperger phone call
added: {{multiple image

On January 2, 2021, during an hour-long conference call, U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] pressured [[Georgia Secretary of State]] [[Brad Raffensperger]] to change [[2020 United States presidential election in Georgia|the state's vote totals]] from the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]]. Trump had been defeated by [[Joe Biden]] in the election, but refused to accept the outcome<ref name="AmySupervilleBrumback">{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|title=Trump, on tape, presses Ga. official to 'find' him votes|work=AP News|first1=Jeff|last1=Amy|first2=Darlene|last2=Superville|first3=Kate|last3=Brumback|date=January 4, 2021|access-date=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104000015/https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-georgia-elections-a7b4aa4d8ce3bf52301ddbe620c6bff6|url-status=live}}</ref> and made a [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|months-long effort to overturn the results]]. Prior to the call to Raffensperger, Trump spoke repeatedly to state and local officials in at least three states in which he had lost, urging them to recount votes, throw out some ballots, or replace the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] slate of electors with a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] slate. Trump's call with Raffensperger was first reported by ''[[The Washington Post]]'' and other media outlets the day after it took place.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia.html|title=Trump, in Taped Call, Pressured Georgia Official to 'Find' Votes to Overturn Election|first1=Michael D.|last1=Shear|first2=Stephanie|last2=Saul|author-link=Michael D. Shear|author-link2=Stephanie Saul|work=The New York Times|date=January 3, 2021|access-date=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104002713/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="trump begs">{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-begs-georgia-secretary-state-overturn-election-results-remarkable-hourlong-n1252692|title=Trump begs Georgia secretary of state to overturn election results in remarkable hourlong phone call|work=NBC News|first1=Allan|last1=Smith|first2=Julia|last2=Jester|first3=Priscilla|last3=Thompson|date=January 3, 2021|access-date=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103234707/https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-begs-georgia-secretary-state-overturn-election-results-remarkable-hourlong-n1252692|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-demands-georgia-secretary-state-find-votes-hand/story?id=75027350|title=Trump demands Georgia secretary of state 'find' enough votes to hand him win|work=ABC News|first=Quinn|last=Scanlon|date=January 4, 2021|access-date=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104020714/https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-demands-georgia-secretary-state-find-votes-hand/story?id=75027350|url-status=live}}</ref>

According to the publicly released recording of the call and reports made by multiple news agencies, Trump attempted to pressure the Secretary into "finding him votes," despite being repeatedly told that there was no electoral error. Trump's repeated efforts to convince the Secretary to find some basis to overturn the election results were perceived as pleading and threatening. At one point on the call, Trump told Raffensperger, "What I want to do is this. I just want to find 11,780 votes, which is one more than [the 11,779 vote margin of defeat] we have, because we won the state."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|title='This Was A Scam': In Recorded Call, Trump Pushed Official To Overturn Georgia Vote|work=NPR|first=Stephen|last=Fowler|date=January 3, 2021|access-date=January 4, 2021|archive-date=January 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210103233114/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/03/953012128/this-was-a-scam-in-recorded-call-trump-pushed-official-to-overturn-georgia-vote|url-status=live}}</ref> During the call, Trump falsely suggested that Raffensperger could have committed a criminal offense. Legal experts have suggested that Trump's behavior and demands could have violated state and federal laws.<ref>Multiple sources:

* {{Cite news|last=Lipton|first=Eric|date=2021-01-04|title=Trump Call to Georgia Official Might Violate State and Federal Law|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0362-4331|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104192131/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/03/us/politics/trump-call-georgia.html|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web|first=Katelyn|last=Polantz|first2=Christina|last2=Carrega|title=Trump's call could put the President in jeopardy, legal experts say|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/04/politics/trump-call-legal-jeopardy/index.html|date=January 4, 2021|access-date=2021-01-04|website=CNN|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104214201/https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/04/politics/trump-call-legal-jeopardy/index.html|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web |title=Trump's Call To Georgia Election Officials Sparks Debate Over Legality, Ethics |url=https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |access-date=2021-01-04 |website=NPR.org |date=January 4, 2021 |first=Jaclyn |last=Diaz |first2=Brian |last2=Naylor |archive-date=January 4, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104234202/https://www.npr.org/2021/01/04/953151921/trumps-call-to-georgia-election-officials-sparks-debate-over-legality-ethics |url-status=live }}

* {{Cite news|last=Greve (now)|first=Joan E.|last2=Holmes (earlier)|first2=Oliver|last3=Pengelly|first3=Martin|last4=Pengelly|first4=Martin|date=2021-01-04|title='Easily, provably false': Georgia elections official refutes Trump's baseless claims of fraud – live|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2021/jan/04/donald-trump-georgia-votes-joe-biden-brad-raffensperger-senate-covid-coronavirus-us-politics-live|access-date=2021-01-04|issn=0261-3077|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212447/https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2021/jan/04/donald-trump-georgia-votes-joe-biden-brad-raffensperger-senate-covid-coronavirus-us-politics-live|url-status=live}}

* {{Cite web|last=Millhiser|first=Ian|date=2021-01-04|title=4 criminal laws that Trump may have violated in his Georgia election call|url=https://www.vox.com/2021/1/4/22213031/trump-georgia-crime-criminal-brad-raffensperger-election-call-fraud-felony|access-date=2021-01-04|website=Vox|language=en|archive-date=January 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210104221038/https://www.vox.com/2021/1/4/22213031/trump-georgia-crime-criminal-brad-raffensperger-election-call-fraud-felony|url-status=live}}</ref>

On January 11, the phone call was cited in the article of impeachment in the [[Second impeachment of Donald Trump|second impeachment of Donald Trump]] introduced in the House of Representatives.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 11, 2021 |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/2021/01/11/nation/read-full-text-article-impeachment-filed-against-president-trump/ |work=Boston Globe |title=Read the full text of the article of impeachment filed against President Trump |access-date=January 11, 2021 |archive-date=January 14, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210114194029/https://www.bostonglobe.com/2021/01/11/nation/read-full-text-article-impeachment-filed-against-president-trump/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

In February 2021, Raffensperger’s office opened a fact-finding and administrative investigation of potential election interference regarding Trump’s efforts to overturn the results in Georgia, and [[Fulton County, Georgia|Fulton County]] prosecutors opened a criminal investigation.<ref name=reuters>{{cite news |first=Linda |last=So |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-georgia-investigation-exclu-idUSKBN2A82HO |title=Georgia Secretary of State's office launches probe into Trump's election phone call |work=Reuters |date=February 8, 2021 |accessdate=February 10, 2021 |archive-date=February 9, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210209224544/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-georgia-investigation-exclu-idUSKBN2A82HO |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Fausset |first1=Richard |title=Georgia Prosecutors Open Criminal Investigation of Trump Phone Call |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/us/politics/trump-georgia-investigation.html |publisher=The New York Times |date=February 10, 2021 |access-date=February 10, 2021 |archive-date=February 10, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210210193830/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/us/politics/trump-georgia-investigation.html |url-status=live }}</ref>
